FuncDef:
The qos queue-alarm command is used to set the queue packet loss alarm threshold.
The undo qos queue-alarm  command used to restore the default value of the queue packet loss alarm threshold. The qos queue-alarm command is used to set the queue packet loss alarm threshold. The undo qos queue-alarm  command used to restore the default value of the queue packet loss alarm threshold. By default, the alarm threshold for the packet loss rate of a port queue is 10.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the queue index.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

Specifies the alarm threshold for the packet loss rate of a port queue.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295. The default value is 10.
